- For $|x| < 1/(2b_n)$, we have $\varphi(b_n x) = 1$, so $f_n(x) = \frac{a_n}{n!} x^n$.

2. Taylor coefficients: For $|x|$ small enough, $f(x) = \sum_{n=0}^\infty \frac{a_n}{n!} x^n$, so $f^{(n)}(0) = n! a_n$.

\sum_{n=0}^\infty a_n \frac{x^n}{n!} \psi_n(x) & x > 0 \\
a_0 & x = 0 \\
\sum_{n=0}^\infty a_n \frac{x^n}{n!} \psi_n(-x) & x < 0
\end{cases}$$
Then $f$ is $C^\infty$ and has the desired Taylor series.

This proves Borel's theorem: every formal power series is the Taylor series of some $C^\infty$ function."
